channel.title: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?
channel.description:
It's rumoured VM are block Rapidshare, Megaupload etc
I know since 5PMish those sites have not been working for me, and as a RS Premium user it's pretty fucking annoying they think they can do something like this.
Luckily, appending Rapidshare links with https:// (secure http) is a work around.

item.title: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

They started working again the next day anyway… me jumping to premature conclusions! :o

Read full topic

item.source: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?

item.title: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:339971”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=436348.msg3212228#msg3212228 date=1274369925]

http://www.opendns.com/

You can use these DNS servers for your DNS needs:
208.67.222.222
208.67.220.220

By www.opendns.com you mean http://opennicproject.org/ right?

By using those DNS Servers you mean infact using:

http://opennicproject.org/index.php/start-here/51-migrate-to-opennic/75-public-dns rite?
[/quote]

No, I don’t believe so, because from what I can tell from that website is that they have nothing to do with OpenDNS. And on their list opendns’s servers aren’t listed either.[/quote]

By that you mean you’re an idiot?

Read full topic

item.title: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:11, topic:339971”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=436348.msg3209793#msg3209793 date=1274134632]
http://www.opendns.com/

You can use these DNS servers for your DNS needs:
208.67.222.222
208.67.220.220
[/quote]

By www.opendns.com you mean http://opennicproject.org/ right?

By using those DNS Servers you mean infact using:

http://opennicproject.org/index.php/start-here/51-migrate-to-opennic/75-public-dns rite?[/quote]

No, I don’t believe so, because from what I can tell from that website is that they have nothing to do with OpenDNS. And on their list opendns’s servers aren’t listed either.

@The_Un-Named wrote:

Read full topic
item.source: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?

item.title: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I’m not sure on the full story- could be a dns issue it just seemed a little outrageous for all the file hosting sites to stop working at the same time o_0.

Whatever happens it can’t last for long because it’s restriction to completely legitimate hosting websites. The customer base would never have it. Although now I’m thinking I was just too high and the people I were talking to on IRC (not #mopar) overlooked the DNS issues PARANOIA.

I download about 50gb/per month from rapidshare at the minute so it would have been a loss.

Read full topic
item.source: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?

item.title: Virgin Media blocking file hosting sites?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I’m on Virgin Media and can access both sites.

Megaupload came back with “Document contains no data” but a simple refresh made it work.

Read full topic
